page.title: 05A UNIQUE GRAVEYARD
page.content:
I live on top of an Anglo Saxon burial ground.The burial ground is to the North of Ruskington. They only dug eighteen inches deep. They found 7 skeletons. The land-area they dug was about 1 acre. Some of the skeletons showed traces of diseases such as gum-boils & root-abcesses. One skull showed evidence of a mastoid abcess. The graves also contained pots, knives, beads, rings, brooches, keys, sleeve clasps,and crystal beads. One skeleton was thought to have been that of a girl aged between 10 and 12 years. Another had a bright green stain on a rib, indicating that something bronze had pressed down on the bone.
By Ian Richardson - aged 10 years.
